_documentation: This subcomponent implements structured methodologies and tools for assessing AI system alignment with human values, safety constraints, and intended purposes through systematic testing, benchmarking, and analysis of system behaviors and capabilities.
name: Evaluation Frameworks
description: Structured methodologies and tools for assessing AI system alignment with human values, safety constraints, and intended purposes through systematic testing, benchmarking, and analysis of system behaviors and capabilities.

capabilities.name: Criteria Application
capabilities.description: Capability to systematically apply alignment criteria to AI systems

functions.name: Criteria Application
functions.description: Systematically apply established alignment criteria to AI systems

specifications.name: Criteria Application Methodology
specifications.description: Technical specifications for systematically applying alignment criteria to AI systems
requirements: Standardized methods to apply criteria across diverse AI systems
Consistent evaluation protocols for reliable assessment
Measurement techniques for both qualitative and quantitative criteria
Documentation standards for evaluation processes and results

integration.name: Criteria Application Implementation
integration.description: Integration approach for implementing criteria application methodology

techniques.name: Systematic Evaluation Technique
techniques.description: Technique for systematic application of alignment criteria to AI systems

applications.name: Alignment Criteria Matrix
applications.description: Structured matrix approach for comprehensive alignment criteria application

inputs.name: AI System Access
inputs.description: Access to the AI system being evaluated
inputs.constraints: Must allow execution of test cases and inspection of system responses

inputs.name: Alignment Criteria Set
inputs.description: Set of defined alignment criteria to be applied
inputs.constraints: Must include clear success/failure conditions for each criterion

outputs.name: Evaluation Results
outputs.description: Comprehensive results from applying criteria to the system
outputs.interpretation: Documents alignment status for each criterion with supporting evidence

outputs.name: Alignment Score
outputs.description: Quantified measure of alignment across evaluated criteria
outputs.interpretation: Provides standardized measurement of alignment status

functions.name: Alignment Criteria Development
functions.description: Define measurable alignment criteria for diverse AI systems

specifications.name: Criteria Specification Framework
specifications.description: Technical specifications for developing measurable alignment criteria
requirements: Methodologies for identifying key alignment dimensions
Processes for operationalizing abstract alignment concepts into measurable criteria
Standards for criteria specificity and falsifiability
Guidelines for domain-specific criteria adaptation

integration.name: Criteria Development Implementation
integration.description: Integration approach for implementing alignment criteria development

techniques.name: Alignment Operationalization Technique
techniques.description: Technique for transforming abstract alignment principles into measurable criteria

applications.name: Alignment Criteria Design Process
applications.description: Systematic process for designing measurable alignment criteria

inputs.name: Alignment Principles
inputs.description: Core alignment principles to be operationalized
inputs.constraints: Must include both technical and normative alignment requirements

inputs.name: System Characteristics
inputs.description: Technical characteristics of the AI systems to be evaluated
inputs.constraints: Must specify capabilities, domains, and application contexts

outputs.name: Measurable Criteria
outputs.description: Set of measurable criteria for alignment evaluation
outputs.interpretation: Provides concrete, testable criteria for alignment assessment

outputs.name: Measurement Methodology
outputs.description: Methods for measuring compliance with each criterion
outputs.interpretation: Enables consistent application of criteria across systems

capabilities.name: Assessment Methodologies
capabilities.description: Structured approaches for comprehensive alignment assessment

functions.name: Assessment Execution

techniques.name: Structured Assessment Technique
techniques.description: Technique for conducting structured alignment assessments

inputs.name: Assessment Methodology
inputs.description: Specific methodology selected for the assessment
inputs.constraints: Must include assessment steps, required resources, and quality controls

inputs.name: System Under Assessment
inputs.description: AI system being assessed for alignment
inputs.constraints: Must provide sufficient access for executing all assessment procedures

outputs.name: Raw Assessment Data
outputs.description: Unprocessed data collected during assessment execution
outputs.interpretation: Provides evidence base for alignment evaluation

outputs.name: Process Documentation

outputs.interpretation: Ensures reproducibility and accountability of assessment

functions.name: Findings Reporting
functions.description: Document and communicate alignment assessment findings

specifications.description: Technical specifications for reporting alignment assessment findings

Evidence presentation guidelines for transparency

techniques.name: Structured Reporting Technique
techniques.description: Technique for structured reporting of alignment assessment findings

applications.name: Comprehensive Report Generation
applications.description: System for generating comprehensive alignment assessment reports

inputs.name: Assessment Results
inputs.description: Results from completed alignment assessment
inputs.constraints: Must include all data points, metrics, and observations from assessment

inputs.name: Target Audience
inputs.description: Information about intended audience for the report
inputs.constraints: Must specify technical background, role, and information needs

outputs.name: Assessment Report
outputs.description: Comprehensive report documenting assessment findings
outputs.interpretation: Communicates alignment status, evidence, and recommendations

outputs.name: Executive Summary
outputs.description: Condensed summary of key findings for decision-makers
outputs.interpretation: Highlights critical alignment status and implications for governance

capabilities.name: Alignment Criteria

outputs.interpretation: Provides operationalized criteria for evaluating alignment

outputs.name: Measurement Methods

outputs.interpretation: Enables consistent application of criteria in evaluations

inputs.description: Set of standardized tasks for alignment assessment

capabilities.name: Boundary Testing
capabilities.description: Detection of subtle misalignment in complex scenarios

functions.name: Scenario Testing
functions.description: Design and execute test scenarios to probe alignment boundaries

specifications.name: Scenario Design Framework
specifications.description: Technical specifications for designing and executing boundary-probing test scenarios
requirements: Methodologies for identifying critical boundary conditions
Techniques for generating diverse test scenarios
Protocols for scenario execution and data collection

inputs.description: Technical capabilities of the AI system being tested
inputs.constraints: Must include operational scope and known capabilities

inputs.description: Key alignment parameters to be tested for boundaries
inputs.constraints: Must specify parameters with boundary conditions of interest

outputs.name: Test Scenarios
outputs.description: Set of boundary-probing test scenarios
outputs.interpretation: Provides structured scenarios for detecting alignment boundaries

outputs.name: Boundary Analysis
outputs.description: Analysis of identified alignment boundaries

functions.name: Robustness Evaluation
functions.description: Assess system responses to edge cases and adversarial inputs

specifications.name: Robustness Evaluation Framework
specifications.description: Technical specifications for evaluating AI system robustness at alignment boundaries
requirements: Methods for generating adversarial inputs and edge cases
Protocols for stress testing system responses
Techniques for measuring response degradation
Frameworks for resilience quantification

integration.description: Integration approach for implementing robustness evaluation framework

techniques.name: Adversarial Testing Technique
techniques.description: Technique for systematically testing robustness through adversarial approaches

applications.name: Comprehensive Robustness Assessment
applications.description: Systematic assessment of system robustness through adversarial testing

inputs.name: AI System
inputs.description: AI system to be evaluated for robustness
inputs.constraints: Must allow controlled testing with adversarial inputs

inputs.name: Adversarial Test Suite
inputs.description: Suite of adversarial inputs and edge cases
inputs.constraints: Must include diverse adversarial strategies and edge cases

outputs.name: Robustness Metrics
outputs.description: Quantitative metrics of system robustness
outputs.interpretation: Measures resilience to adversarial inputs and edge cases

outputs.name: Vulnerability Report
outputs.description: Detailed report of identified vulnerabilities
outputs.interpretation: Maps points of failure and alignment degradation under stress

capabilities.name: Contextual Assessment
capabilities.description: Comprehensive testing across diverse operational contexts

functions.name: Scenario Testing
functions.description: Design and execute test scenarios to probe alignment boundaries

specifications.name: Contextual Scenarios Framework

requirements: Methodologies for identifying diverse operational contexts
Techniques for generating context-specific test scenarios
Protocols for context-sensitive evaluation
Standards for context representation and simulation

integration.name: Contextual Scenarios Implementation
integration.description: Integration approach for implementing contextual scenario testing

techniques.name: Context Simulation Technique
techniques.description: Technique for simulating diverse operational contexts for alignment testing

applications.name: Context-Driven Test Suite
applications.description: Comprehensive suite of context-sensitive alignment test scenarios

inputs.name: AI System
inputs.description: AI system to be tested across contexts
inputs.constraints: Must allow testing in multiple simulated contexts

inputs.name: Context Specifications
inputs.description: Specifications of operational contexts to be simulated
inputs.constraints: Must include diverse sociotechnical and operational parameters

outputs.name: Context-Sensitivity Report
outputs.description: Report on system behavior across different contexts
outputs.interpretation: Identifies context-dependent alignment variations

outputs.name: Contextual Alignment Metrics
outputs.description: Metrics showing alignment performance across contexts
outputs.interpretation: Quantifies alignment sensitivity to contextual factors

functions.name: Impact Assessment
functions.description: Evaluate potential impacts of AI systems on different stakeholders and society

specifications.name: Impact Assessment Framework
specifications.description: Technical specifications for evaluating potential impacts of AI systems on stakeholders and society
requirements: Methods for identifying stakeholder groups and potential impacts
Frameworks for assessing impacts across different societal dimensions
Techniques for measuring direct and indirect effects
Standards for impact severity classification and prioritization

integration.name: Impact Assessment Implementation
integration.description: Integration approach for implementing impact assessment framework

techniques.name: Stakeholder Impact Analysis Technique
techniques.description: Technique for analyzing impacts across diverse stakeholder groups

applications.name: Comprehensive Societal Impact Assessment
applications.description: Multidimensional assessment of AI system impacts across stakeholder groups and society

inputs.name: AI System Model
inputs.description: Technical and operational model of the AI system being assessed
inputs.constraints: Must include capabilities, deployment context, and interaction patterns

inputs.name: Stakeholder Landscape
inputs.description: Mapping of stakeholder groups affected by the system
inputs.constraints: Must include diverse groups across power, access, and vulnerability dimensions

outputs.name: Impact Report
outputs.description: Comprehensive analysis of potential impacts across stakeholders
outputs.interpretation: Details positive and negative impacts across stakeholder groups

outputs.name: Risk Assessment
outputs.description: Evaluation of potential societal risks posed by the system
outputs.interpretation: Identifies and prioritizes risks for mitigation

cross_connections.description: Criteria Application provides standardized criteria that Assessment Methodologies rely on for execution
Boundary Testing and Contextual Assessment work together to provide comprehensive alignment evaluation
Criteria Development enables effective Criteria Application by providing well-defined alignment measures
Impact Assessment findings inform priorities for Robustness Evaluation

implementation_considerations.name: Methodological Rigor
considerations: Ensuring evaluation procedures meet scientific standards of validity and reliability
Balancing comprehensive assessment with practical resource constraints
Standardizing evaluation protocols to enable comparability across systems
Addressing unique challenges of evaluating emergent AI capabilities

implementation_considerations.name: Measurement Challenges
considerations: Developing metrics for abstract alignment concepts like ethics and values
Avoiding measurement bias that misrepresents actual alignment status

implementation_considerations.name: Context Sensitivity
considerations: Ensuring evaluations account for variations in operational contexts
Developing frameworks that generalize across diverse domains
Balancing breadth of contextual testing with depth of evaluation
Addressing challenges in simulating realistic deployment contexts

implementation_considerations.name: Stakeholder Integration
considerations: Ensuring diverse stakeholder perspectives inform evaluation frameworks
Balancing technical expertise with stakeholder representation
Developing participatory methods for evaluation framework design
Communicating evaluation results effectively to diverse audiences

technical_specifications._documentation: This section provides technical details about the evaluation-frameworks subcomponent.

input_requirements.name: AI System Access
input_requirements.description: Access to AI systems for evaluation purposes
input_requirements.format: System interfaces, APIs, or direct access to model internals
input_requirements.constraints: Must provide sufficient visibility into system behavior and decision-making

input_requirements.name: Alignment Criteria
input_requirements.format: Formalized criteria with clear measurement methodologies
input_requirements.constraints: Must be precise, measurable, and relevant to alignment goals

input_requirements.name: Test Scenarios
input_requirements.description: Scenarios designed to probe alignment properties
input_requirements.format: Structured scenarios with defined inputs, contexts, and expected behaviors
input_requirements.constraints: Must cover diverse conditions and alignment dimensions

input_requirements.name: Stakeholder Data
input_requirements.description: Information about stakeholders for impact assessment
input_requirements.format: Stakeholder maps, impact models, and contextual information
input_requirements.constraints: Must represent diverse stakeholders including marginalized groups

output_specifications.name: Assessment Reports
output_specifications.description: Comprehensive reports of alignment evaluation findings
output_specifications.format: Structured reports with evidence, metrics, and recommendations
output_specifications.usage: Informing governance decisions and system improvements

output_specifications.name: Alignment Metrics
output_specifications.description: Quantitative measures of alignment across dimensions
output_specifications.format: Standardized metrics with clear interpretation guidelines
output_specifications.usage: Tracking alignment status and comparing systems

output_specifications.name: Alignment Boundary Maps
output_specifications.description: Mappings of alignment boundaries and failure modes
output_specifications.format: Visual and formal representations of alignment boundaries

output_specifications.name: Impact Analyses
output_specifications.description: Analyses of potential impacts across stakeholders
output_specifications.format: Structured impact assessments with risk profiles
output_specifications.usage: Informing deployment decisions and risk mitigation

performance_characteristics.throughput: Evaluation frameworks should scale to handle multiple system evaluations simultaneously
performance_characteristics.latency: Critical alignment evaluations should complete within timeframes relevant to deployment decisions
performance_characteristics.scalability: Methods should scale from small models to frontier systems
performance_characteristics.resource_utilization: Evaluation procedures should be optimized for efficient use of computational resources

relationships._documentation: This section details how this subcomponent relates to other components and subcomponents in the architecture.

items.description: Provides evaluation methodologies that monitoring systems use to assess alignment during operation
Complements verification mechanisms by providing standardized frameworks for assessing alignment properties
Evaluation results inform governance decisions about AI system deployment and operation
Provides specialized implementation of alignment verification approaches

references.title: Model cards for model reporting
references.venue: Proceedings of the Conference on Fairness, Accountability, and Transparency

references.title: Towards a rigorous science of interpretable machine learning
Closing the AI accountability gap: Defining an end-to-end framework for internal algorithmic auditing
references.venue: Proceedings of the 2020 Conference on Fairness, Accountability, and Transparency

references.title: Fairness and abstraction in sociotechnical systems
references.venue: Proceedings of the Conference on Fairness, Accountability, and Transparency

references.title: The role and limits of principles in AI ethics: Towards a focus on tensions
references.venue: Proceedings of the 2021 AAAI/ACM Conference on AI, Ethics, and Society

references.title: Society-in-the-loop: Programming the algorithmic social contract

literature_connections.relevant_aspects: Provides methodological framework for comprehensive evaluation of language model capabilities that can be adapted for alignment assessment
Introduces standardized reporting frameworks for model characteristics that inform evaluation report design
Provides rigorous framework for operationalizing abstract concepts like interpretability that can be applied to alignment criteria
Identifies concrete safety problems that inform adversarial testing approaches for alignment assessment
Provides end-to-end framework for algorithmic auditing that informs structured assessment approaches
Highlights sociotechnical gaps in abstracted technical evaluations that inform contextual assessment approaches
Examines tensions in operationalizing ethical principles that inform alignment criteria development
Proposes society-in-the-loop approaches that inform contextual scenario design for alignment evaluation
